page.title: 10The Grand Western Canal.
page.content: The Canal was built in the early nineteenth century. It was not long however, before the railway was built between Taunton and Exeter. Eventually the canal was closed and slowly fell into disrepair. We set off on our walk, in a field near Longaller Farm, expecting to see a canal full of water but there wasn't much evidence that there had been a canal at all! We did see an old wooden bridge crossing a ditch, but the farmer had filled most of it in. After crossing fields we actually found some water but it looked just like a pond. Then there was a length of embankment which showed the route of the canal quite clearly. We saw the best preserved length of canal near Bradford-on-Tone, on either side of Trefusis Farm. One part of it had recently been cleared as a fish pond.
